description: Repeatedly apply Euler phi to n; a(n) = number of iterations that are applied to numbers that are not powers of 2.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
formula: The smallest x so that Nest[ EulerPhi, n, x ] = 2^w is just achieved.
example: If n is a power of 2, then a(n)=0 by definition. If n=59049, then {59049,39366,13122,4374,1458,486,54,18,6,2,1}. This phi-sequence has a length of 12 and includes 10 non-2-powers, so a(59049)=8.
author: _Labos Elemer_
